panels.description: Shows the request rate per verb and resource for the API server.
panels.title: API Server Request Rates Per Verb And Resource
Request Terminations By Resource And Code

panels.description:
This panel shows the rate of response sizes by resource and verb.

Outstandingly high values could give a hint for shoot operators on where
to start on the journey of reducing the load on the API servers,
by making sure to use WATCH requests instead of periodic LIST and
GET requests in the various controllers.

High values for WATCH requests could hint at reducing the rate of change for the specific resource.
panels.title: Response Size Rate Per Resource and Verb
Total Storage Transformation Operations By Type And Prefix

panels.description: Panel shows how many watches are open (including the API Server's in-tree admission plug-ins).

targets.expr:
sum by (kind) (apiserver_registered_watchers{job=~"$job",pod=~"$pod",kind!=""})
  + on () group_left ()
    absent(apiserver_longrunning_requests) * 0
or
  sum by (resource) (apiserver_longrunning_requests{job=~"$job",pod=~"$pod",verb="WATCH"})

panels.title: Registered Watches Per Kind

panels.description: Counter of init events processed in watch cache.
panels.title: Init Event Count Per Resource

panels.description: Shows the watch event count per kind
